content.title: National Security Act of 1947 (as amended through October 7, 2010)
content.text: An Act that promotes national security by providing the Secretary of Defense for a National Military Establishment, a Department of the Army, a Department of the Navy, a Department of the Air Force and the coordination of the activities of the National Military.

content.title: Reducing Over-Classification Act
content.text: Requires the Secretary of Homeland Security to develop a strategy to prevent the over-classification of homeland security and other information. Promotes the sharing of unclassified homeland security and other information, and for other purposes.
